content:
Put simply... I'm a gamer. I could end it there quite happily and that's that.
You could stop here and I'd tell you that that is the same impression you'd
walk away with after reading all of this.

I can't remember the exact date in which I was introduced to gaming, but I
think I can make a pretty accurate stab at the progression I had... Gamegear,
to Playstation 2, to GBA, to SNES, to SEGA MegaDrive (or similar SEGA system),
to a GameBoy DS, to Playstation 3, to Wii, to PC, to Playstation 4.

Even though I was introduced to a computer a lot earlier than listed (I think
that it was 2002 when I was introduced), I didn't start gaming on one properly
until a lot later when I had money to burn and the PC gaming market really
started flying with the introduction of direct downloading.

And even then, that was quite late... I've only been on Steam since about
July 2011.

I'm sad to say that I'm one of those scumbags that prefer console gaming. I
like the assurance that no-matter what game I get, it will run on this one
box that I don't have to do anything with. However... that doesn't mean I
hate PC gaming... I love it; I love the amount of games available at the snap
of a finger at a much lower price than the console market.

Recently, however, I've splashed out on getting a higher spec computer that's
able to do a bit more than stutter and start at every damn game I play. The
fact that it's a desktop already puts it above my laptop, but the key things
to note are that it's running a 6th gen i5, 16 gigabytes of DDR4 RAM, a 4GB
NVIDIA 960 GTX, and a few bells and whistles to keep it running at a stable
28 degrees Celsius.

If you wanted to know about me regarding my non-gaming life... I'm a fourth
year Computing Science student/weirdo at Newcastle University in the UK,
currently specialising into distributed systems and security in computing
because they sounded fancy on the box and present interesting problems to
be solved.

I have around five years of programming experience at this point in scripted
and non-scripted languages such as Python, C/++, Java, and PHP (there are
others, but I don't really want to list them all - those are the ones that
I've had the most recent experience in). I'd classify myself as primarily
either a web developer or a C++ developer at this point in time due to the
sheer amount of time I've sunk into those areas of development.

I'm currently looking into doing a PhD around security which should hopefully
prove interesting and keep me going for the next few years as the UK
collapses around itself. Not quite sure about the specifics of that yet,
but I'm hopeful that I'll be able to get it with the project I have planned
(I'll probably showcase it on here at some point or other when I get around
to finishing the development log part of the site).

In case you were starting to think that I was just a boring gaming person
who did programming most of the time (which... isn't really that far from
the truth - the boring part I mean), I also have a large history of watching
and reading stuff that goes by the genres of anime and manga (because I'm a
student and I have a gargantuan amount of time that I should probably have
spent studying which mysteriously disappeared at some point down the line).
What I have seen/read can be seen on this site in the appropriate headings,
but fair warning... my tastes are somewhat broad and I will watch anything
that piques my interest at any point in time soooo... yeah...

Basically, if you want confirmation that I'm a weirdo, give those two
categories a bit of a search...

So... This is going to sound a tad strange coming from me; someone who sat here and wrote this whole website out across the majority of a year - probably longer, but you probably don't want to see this. This part of the site is going to give you a much, MUCH greater amount of insight about me than any other... except for maybe the personal blog, but even that is somewhat regulated.

This section of the site will cover my very personal affairs in a way that I'm sure will not bite me in the ass in any way, shape, or form. This area of the site acts as a dictionary for the various kinks and fetishes that I am interested in. It was written in because of an incident that happened in August 2018 where someone threatened to post compromising images of myself online for as long as I didn't pay them.

In response to that, I decided to write this; the section of my site where I can point to and say that _'look, I'm not exactly hiding this'_. That's why this space exists, and that's why I'm warning you to turn back. I'll even put it in some bigger text to prove a point...
